quotes.quote: Whiskey will always be a part of my life.
It is true that whisky improves with age. The older I get, the more I like it.
Courage is a vitamin best swallowed with whiskey.
My favorite drink is a cocktail of carrot juice and whiskey. I am always drunk but I can see for miles.
He told me I had to have a whiskey every day to get better.
Whiskey makes my baby, feel a little frisky.
For God's sake bring me a large Scotch. What a bloody awful country.
The true pioneer of civilization is not the newspaper, not religion, not the railroad but whiskey!
Give an Irishman lager for a month and he's a dead man. An Irishman's stomach is lined with copper, and the beer corrodes it. But whiskey polishes the copper and is the saving of him.
We got more provisions for our whiskey than the same money, which we paid for the liquor, would have bought; so after all it proved a very profitable investment.
Love makes the world go round? Not at all. Whiskey makes it go round twice as fast.
I like my whisky old and my women young.
Whisky making is an act of cooperation between the blessings of nature and the wisdom of man.
When life hands you lemons, make whisky sours.
The water was not fit to drink. To make it palatable, we had to add whisky. By diligent effort, I learned to like it.
When asked for his hangover cure, I take the juice of two bottles of whisky.
Whiskey is carried into committee rooms in demijohns and carried out in demagogues.
I'm on a whisky diet. I've lost three days already.
There is no such thing as a bad whisky. Some whiskies just happen to be better than others.
Whiskey, like a beautiful woman, demands appreciation. You gaze first, then it's time to drink.
Brown has an inordinate taste for whiskey.
The whiskey on your breath could make a small boy dizzy;But I hung on like death:Such waltzing was not easy.
What whiskey will not cure, there is no cure for.

I contented myself with whiskey, for medicinal purposes. It helped numb my various aches and pains. Not that the alcohol actually reduced the pain, it just gave the pain a life of its own, apart from mine.
Always carry a flagon of whiskey in case of snakebite and furthermore always carry a small snake.
A good gulp of hot whiskey at bedtime it's not very scientific, but it helps.
Whiskey is by far the most popular of all remedies that won't cure a cold.
Whiskey has killed more men than bullets, but most men would rather be full of whiskey than bullets. What I like in a good author is not what he says, but what he whispers.
Whiskey claims to itself alone the exclusive office of sot-making.
Too much of anything is bad, but too much good whiskey is barely enough.
